remarks: Definition *14.01 in [WhiteheadRussell] p. 184.  In Principia Mathematica, Russell and Whitehead define ` iota ` in terms of a function of ` ( iota x ph ) ` .  Their definition differs in that a function of ` ( iota x ph ) ` evaluates to "false" when there isn't a single ` x ` that satisfies ` ph ` .  (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 11-Jul-2011.)
statement:
iotasbc $p |- ( E! x ph -> ( [. ( iota x ph ) / y ]. ps <-> E. y ( A. x ( ph <-> x = y ) /\ ps ) ) ) $.
$d ph y $.
$d x y $.
